title: Easter Resurrection, First Fruits of the New Creation
description:
There's some grieving this Easter. No service. No family gatherings. We're used to a celebration and instead because of COVID its just more isolation. 

Does this calamity surprise us? Stephen Jenkinson who was a hospice counselor notes that Western culture inculcates a culture of surprise and denial at misfortune and death, but death is inevitable and should be expected. 

CS Lewis in Life in an Atomic Age wonders what kind of world we thought we were living in. If there is only "Nature" then our doom is sure. 

Lewis also notes, however, that what we are talking about when we talk about Jesus' resurrection is not just the unwinding of Nature, but it's renovation and rejuvenation. Humpty Dumpty doesn't just fall from the wall, the wall and Humpty will be remade and this gives us hope. 

Stephen Jenkinson Death https://youtu.be/_m3f79PvBXU
Weinsteins Video https://youtu.be/xkuw8dDAThA
CS lewis Miracles https://amzn.to/3aWLX7H
CS Lewis The Last Battle https://amzn.to/3b480t9

Click here to meetup with other channel viewers for conversation https://discord.gg/2uUhZBK The link will prompt you to download the software for this free group messaging service. This link updates every 100 users so look for the most recent videos if this link doesn't work.

If you want to schedule a one-on-one conversation check here. https://paulvanderklay.me/2019/08/06/converzations-with-pvk/

If you need the RSS feed for your podcast player https://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/feed/
